\N<Ryuda Soldier>As a life-prolonging measure for your husband who is
imprisoned, you are obligated to pay gold every 5 days
during the training period.
\N<Ryuda Soldier>The amount imposed on you this time is \C[1][2000 MO]\C[0].
\N<Ryuda Soldier>Are you prepared to make the payment this time?\$

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hmm... indeed. You have worked hard. It would be good for
you to continue to strive in the future.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>However... should you stop the payments out of self-
preservation, we will simply carry out the procedure without
hesitation.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>What is this charade? You also do not have enough money on
hand to meet the conditions.

\N<Segi>...

\N<Ryuda Soldier>What's the matter? Silence won't start anything. Do what you
must do.
\N<Segi>Th-that is...

\N<Ryuda Soldier>...I see. I understand everything. It seems you were not up
to the task after all.

\N<Segi>Please, wait! If you could just wait a little longer, I will
definitely have the money...!

\N<Ryuda Soldier>You have already been given ample grace period. There will
be no further leniency.
\N<Segi>But, but!!

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Come now. I said you were not up to the task, but
fortunately, it seems you still have some value to us.

A
\N<Ryuda Soldier>Good work, continue to strive in the future.
\N<Segi>What...? What's all this commotion...?

\N<Subordinate Of Zeda>Let go! I'm a subordinate of Lord Zeda! I won't take orders
from the likes of you!

\N<Ryuda Soldier>It doesn't matter, we're taking you in. The howling of a man
who failed to escape from prison isn't worth listening to.
\N<Subordinate Of Zeda>What did you say...!? Let me go! I'll kill all of you!!

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hmph... Zeda, huh. He was just a bit of an oddball in Ryuda,
that's why he was popular.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Besides, if he was really capable, why was he captured as a
prisoner? Huh?

\N<Subordinate Of Zeda>We were just waiting for the right time! Lord Zeda will
eventually...!

\N<Ryuda Soldier>It's all in how you say it. Never mind, take him away
quickly.

\N<Zuuteruka>Yo, Segi. Good timing coming here, are you awake and feeling
alright now?
\N<Segi>Zuuteruka...!

\N<Zuuteruka>I was surprised when you suddenly collapsed. On top of that,
I even took the trouble to carry you home. You could at
least thank me, you know?
\N<Segi>Ugh...!

\N<Zuuteruka>Hehehe, more importantly, what happened? Is it because of
that thing with Zeda?
\N<Segi>Wha...!?

\N<Zuuteruka>I've heard most of it from the man himself, you know?
Hehehe...

\N<Segi>...I don't know what he's told you, but whatever you heard
is all nonsense.

\N<Zuuteruka>Well, I'll let it slide. But... haven't you noticed
something?
\N<Segi>The noise in this facility...?

\N<Zuuteruka>Yeah, you really came at the right time. That Zeda has
escaped from the dungeon.
\N<Segi>Eh...!!??

\N<Zuuteruka>Moreover, he freed his subordinates who were captured with
him.
\N<Segi>Why would he do such a thing...

\N<Zuuteruka>Didn't I tell you...? He's one of Zozoye's men and another
target for purging.
\N<Segi>Ah...

\N<Zuuteruka>Hehehe, probably got scared for his life now. Or maybe after
hearing your voice for the first time in a while, he felt
something?

\N<Segi>That can't be true...! Even if it were, it has nothing to do
with me...
\N<Zuuteruka>Hey hey, don't be so groggy. It's very possible.

\N<Zuuteruka>It seems he's fled to the lowest level of the ruins. I was
thinking of asking you to pursue him.
\N<Segi>Wha...!? Why should I...!?
\N<Zuuteruka>Because he's asking for you, see.
\N<Segi>This is...

\N<Zuuteruka>This is a copy of the note he left behind in his cell. See?
It says for you to come to the ruins. If his demands aren't
met, he'll destroy the ruins from the inside and commit
suicide along with his subordinates.

\N<Zuuteruka>There are still many mysteries in those ruins. They have
research value. That's why we can't afford to have them
destroyed by him now.
\N<Segi>...That's none of my concern.

\N<Zuuteruka>Hehehe, that's not all. He's taken hostages. If you don't
show up, the hostages' lives are forfeit.
\N<Segi>Hostages...?
\N<Zuuteruka>Hehehe... Your dear little son.
\N<Segi>Wha...!!??

\N<Zuuteruka>What will you do? Are you still going to refuse to go? If
you're so fond of your own life, I won't force you.
\N<Segi>Don't joke with me!! Tell me! Where did that man take Riia!?

\N<Zuuteruka>Didn't I say the lowest level of the ruins? It's the
building even further beyond, accessed by the elevator.
\N<Segi>G...gh!!

\N<Zuuteruka>Be very careful, your opponent is desperate. After all, it's
literally a matter of life and death, isn't it?
DW_目標設定 Head_to_the_ruins_to_rescue_Riia.
A

\N<Man>Isn't that Miss Segi? If you have no business here, it's
better not to go any further.

\N<Man>This place used to be a school for the town's children, but
now it has completely changed into an educational facility
for Ruda.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Access beyond this point is prohibited due to an
investigation of the remnants of the deserters.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Access beyond this point is prohibited due to the

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Leave, the area beyond here is currently off-limits.
